text: you know what Charles Darwin said about
the gorgeous Peacocks tail he said it
made him sick why what Darwin couldn't
figure out was why a species would waste
all that energy on looking he answered
his own question he came up with the
idea of sexual selection big antlers
fancy feathers gorgeous colors they can
all attract mates and they can add to
fitness which means leaving more
offspring just as much as sharp claws
and strong muscles but it's never clear
to outsiders just what part of those
feathers is most important for instance
what is the peahen looking at and that's
why researchers came up with a kind of
device that makes the peahen look a
little bit like a cyborg what you're
looking at on the right is the actual
eyeball of the p.m. and what you're
looking at on the left is where the PN's
gaze is going what the pn is looking
what they found out by looking at the
video afterwards is that the male's
can't just stand there and look good
they have to work constantly to get the
females attention so they approach they
fan out their tail they shake their
feathers they turn around the lesson
that the scientists take from this is if
they have a really good system for
studying what he hands or other kinds of
birds or animals are looking at there's
another lesson too it's not enough to
look good you have to know how to shake
a tail thing
